name: Holiday Inn Birmingham City Centre, an IHG Hotel

reviews.text: Good location and budget friendly. Service was great and the rooms were clean and tidy. Definitely enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to anyone traveling to Birmingham.

Had a solo visit to Birmingham last weekend and staying at this hotel was such a great experience. The check-in and out were seamless thanks to Hanin for helpful assistance. The room was clean and tidy, and place was quiet too. Apart from the noise due to work which was done above my room that lasted an hour during the day. The location was at the heart of the city centre with many options from restaurants to attractions. I don’t travel that often but having an experience like this makes me want to go out more.

Great location, very comfortable bed with soft linens and mushy pillows.
Breakfast is very good with a great assortment of pastries, fruits, yogurt, bread, sausages, eggs, bacon. All fresh and available.
The breakfast salon has nice views and is very comfortable and well laid out.

It’s very disappointing to say the least. I checked into Room 1*** on 4th November, and the experience has been poor from start to finish. I complained multiple times at reception, asking them to change the bedsheets, but nothing was done. Every time, they assured me my request was “noted,” yet over my three-day stay, the sheets were never changed.

The carpet looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in ages, with visible stains that could even be pet mess. While the bathroom was clean on my first day, it was completely neglected after that. I even found my own hair left in the shower from the day before – absolutely unacceptable.

I don’t understand why cleanliness isn’t a priority here. I wouldn’t waste my money on this experience again – not what you’d expect from a 4-star hotel in Birmingham City Centre.

The place we were meant to stay didn't provide us with the information on how to check in so we ended up going into the Holiday Inn and booked two rooms. The only thing that was bad was when we went to book the rooms, the person on reception told us we had to book it through booking.com.
With booking it through there it meant we didn't get the breakfast, which is included when you book directly.
Rooms were lovely and the hotel is nice.
